attributes.additional_details: Necessities such as gas, electric, water, and car insurance should be monitored and prices adjusted accordingly to reflect the national average income. It is unaceptable for example that private companies can charge what they like for everyday necessities even though peoples incomes are not increasing. How are young people expected to own a car to travel to work when the law allows insurance and tax to rise to exsessive levels that the persons income can not meet?
